intro: Plagiobothrys collinus, commonly known as the western sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. It has hairy, glandular leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Plagiobothrys collinus is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
